intro: Ornithogalum sulphureum, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a bulbous plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of yellow, star-shaped flowers during the spring and summer. The plant belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking color and unique floral structure. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. However, it is toxic to humans and animals, so caution is advised when handling or consuming any part of the plant.
